[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/encoding_type.rs] [All functions] [Version compatibility] Can encoding format changes during protocol upgrades break backward compatibility, requiring hard forks to fix? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/encoding_type.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Legacy format support] Does decode_key() securely handle legacy encoding formats, or can deprecated formats bypass modern security checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/encoding_type.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Algorithm confusion] Can decode_key() be tricked into decoding keys for different cryptographic algorithms, breaking algorithm isolation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/encoding_type.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Maximum length validation] Is there a maximum encoded length check, or can extremely large keys cause integer overflow in length calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/encoding_type.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Canonical encoding check] Does decode_key() verify that encoded data is in canonical form, or can non-canonical encodings bypass security checks? (High)
